item.title: Customize SPD paper and electronic greeting cards with your own branding
item.description: Source: SPD website. The SPD, a Singaporean organization supporting individuals with disabilities, operates a supported employment facility that creates physical and digital greeting cards. These cards are suitable for various events like birthdays and holidays such as Hari Raya, Deepavali, Christmas, and Chinese New Year. Customization options are available for these cards, including adding company branding, personalized notes, or designs for other special events. Interested parties can explore the complete selection of cards on the SPD e-shop.

item.title: The True Colours Festival showcases performances by exceptionally talented artists with disabilities
item.description: The True Colours Festival, showcasing talented performing artists with disabilities from the Asia Pacific region, will run from March 22nd to 25th, 2018 in Singapore. The festival will feature up to 20 artist/troupe performances representing Japan, China, India, Korea, Malaysia, Cambodia, Kazakhstan, New Zealand, Australia, and Singapore. Guest artists from the UK and Canada will also be featured. Performances will take place at a multimedia concert experience inside the Singapore Indoor Stadium and at the nearby True Colours Festival Village.

item.title: The True Colours Festival includes a number of groundbreaking inclusive initiatives
item.description: Source: True Colours Festival website. Some of the featured performers. This coming March, twenty artists and groups will come together in Singapore for the first and largest event in the Asia Pacific region to showcase performers with disabilities. From March 22-25, 2018, Singapore will host True Colours Festival – the Asia Pacific Celebration of Artistes with Disabilities. True Colours is presented by UNESCO and The Nippon Foundation (TNF), two global organizations that advocate for the rights of people with disabilities (PWDs).

item.title: Helping individuals with disabilities transition from training programs to meaningful employment opportunities
item.description: Individuals with disabilities should be placed in jobs where they can acquire skills on the job, rather than receiving training without a clear path to employment. Christy Lynch, CEO of KARE Ireland, an organization supporting individuals with intellectual disabilities and their families, emphasized the importance of collaborating with both individuals with disabilities and employers to create truly empowering opportunities. He spoke at the “Towards an Inclusive Workforce 2015” event, co-organized by SPD and supported by SG Enable and the Singapore Workforce Development Agency (WDA).
